clinical_study.brief_title: The Value of Enhanced External Counterpulsation Treatment to Erectile Dysfunction

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Enhanced External counterpulsation treatment can improve erectile function

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Erectile function evaluated by International Index of Erectile Function-5 questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: Flow-mediated dilation：In this method,brachial artery diameter is measured before and after an increase in shear stress that is induced by reactive hyperemia (FMD). Endothelial progenitor cells：Flow cytometry to detect changes in the number of endothelial progenitor cells

arm_group.description: Men with erectile dysfunction included for evaluating the erectile function before and after Enhanced external counterpulsation treatment.

intervention.description: Enhanced external counterpulsation is mainly used in Cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases,which can improve the microcirculation.

study_pop.textblock: Men with erectile dysfunction in GuangDong province

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University

reference.citation: El-Sakka A, Morsy A, Fagih B. Enhanced external counterpulsation in patients with coronary artery disease-associated erectile dysfunction. Part I: effects of risk factors. J Sex Med. 2007 May;4(3):771-9. Epub 2007 Apr 13.
